summary: This is a legal memorandum filed by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in support of the FBI's motion for summary judgment in a FOIA lawsuit brought by Radar Online LLC. The document argues that the FBI properly withheld records related to the investigations and prosecutions of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell under various FOIA exemptions, primarily to avoid interfering with the then-pending criminal proceedings against Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Filed the memorandum of law on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in support of the FBI's motion for summary judgment.

persons.name: James Robertson
persons.role: Senior Editor for Radar Online, Plaintiff
persons.context: Plaintiff in the FOIA lawsuit alongside Radar Online LLC, seeking records related to the FBI's investigation of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier whose criminal prosecution for sex trafficking is the subject of the FOIA request. The document details his arrest, charges, and death.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of a pending criminal prosecution at the time of the filing. The FBI argues releasing records would interfere with her trial.

persons.name: Michael G. Seidel
persons.context: FBI official who submitted a declaration detailing the FBI's search and withholding of records in response to the FOIA request.

connections.description: Both were subjects of federal criminal prosecutions for sex trafficking; Maxwell's prosecution was pending at the time of this filing.
As U.S. Attorney, Strauss is representing the FBI (the defendant) in this FOIA lawsuit.
Robertson is identified as a senior editor for Radar Online LLC, and they are co-plaintiffs in the lawsuit.

events.title: Epstein Indicted
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York charged Jeffrey Epstein with conspiracy to commit sex trafficking and sex trafficking.

events.title: Epstein Arrested
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and subsequently incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: FOIA Request Submitted
events.description: Radar Online submitted a FOIA request to the FBI seeking all documents relating to the FBI's investigation and prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Court Orders Processing
events.description: The court ordered the FBI to process 500 pages of responsive records per month.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, Third Floor, New York, New York
keyFacts: The FBI processed 11,525 pages in response to the FOIA request from October 2017 through June 2019, but fully or partially withheld the vast majority (10,107 pages) under FOIA exemptions.
After Epstein's arrest in July 2019, the FBI categorically asserted FOIA Exemption 7(A) to withhold records, arguing release could interfere with the pending prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.
Withheld records included interview notes, grand jury materials, witness statements, flight logs, and communications that could reveal investigative techniques or witness identities.
The FBI's legal argument relies heavily on declarations from Michael G. Seidel (FBI) and a lead AUSA (name redacted) to establish that disclosure would harm law enforcement proceedings.
The document reveals the scale and sensitivity of the Epstein investigation records, highlighting conflicts between public transparency under FOIA and protecting active criminal cases.
